examples: babies can discriminate between different facial expressions of emotion

verb.description: Make an unjust or prejudicial distinction in the treatment of different categories of people or things, especially on the grounds of race, sex, or age.
examples: existing employment policies discriminate against women

origin: Early 17th century: from Latin discriminat- distinguished between, from the verb discriminare, from discrimen distinction, from the verb discernere (see discern).
